children.name: storm door
children.definition: USan extra door which is fitted to the usual door or window for protection in bad weather : cửa ngoài

children.name: swing door
children.definition: UKswinging doorUS a door that can be opened in either direction and is closed by a spring device when released : cửa mở hai chiều
examples: Quickly, I crashed through a swing door on my left.

children.name: turnstile
children.definition: a small gate that spins around and only lets one person at a time go through an entrance: cửa quay (an ninh)
examples: We’ve had 600,000 admissions through the turnstiles.
The number of spectators going through the turnstiles is up on last season.

children.name: revolving door
children.definition: a set of doors which you go through by pushing them round in a circle:cửa quay
examples: Wordlessly, he stepped through the revolving door and into the building.

children.name: fire door
children.definition: a door made of material that cannot burn which is used to prevent a fire from spreading within a building : cửa chống cháy

children.name: stage door
children.definition: the door which is used by the actors and theatre workers when entering and leaving the theatre
examples: We stood by the stage door waiting to get the actors' autographs.

children.name: trapdoor
children.definition: a small door that covers an opening in a roof or floor:cửa sập,cửa lật
examples: There's a trapdoorintothe attic.

children.name: screen door
children.definition: US a door consisting of a wire net with very small holes stretched over a frame, which allows air but not insects to move through it : cửa chắn

children.name: gate
children.definition: the part of a fence or outside wall that you can open and close so that you can enter or leave a place:
examples: We went through the gate into the orchard.

children.name: the front/back gate
children.definition: the gate in front of or at the back of a building
examples: She stood outside the front gate of the cottage.

children.name: the entrance gate
examples: Derek met us at the entrance gate.

children.name: the main gate
children.definition: where most people go in
examples: Soldiers were guarding the main gate.

children.name: a garden gate
examples: Ellie ran down the path towards the garden gate.

children.name: a farm/factory/school etc gate
examples: I carefully shut the farm gate behind me.|Lots of parents were waiting outside the school gate.

children.name: a wooden/iron/wrought-iron gate
examples: Their way was barred by huge wrought-iron gates.

children.name: open a gate
examples: He heard Jack open the gate.

children.name: close/shut a gate
examples: Please close the gate.

children.name: lock/padlock a gate
children.definition: close it with a key/a special lock
examples: She locked the gate behind her.

children.name: go through a gate
examples: They went through the gate into the orchard.

children.name: leave the gate open
examples: Someone left the gate open, and the dog got out.

children.name: the wrought-iron gates of the palace
door
children.definition: the large flat piece of wood, glass etc that you move when you go into or out of a building, room, vehicle etc, or when you open a cupboard:
examples: Could you open the door for me?
The door flew open and Ruth stormed in.
Don’t forget to lock the garage door.

children.name: open/close/shut the door
examples: I opened the door and Dad was standing there.|Can you close the door as you go out?

children.name: slam/bang the door
children.definition: shut it loudly, usually because you are angry
examples: He strode from the room, slamming the door behind him.

children.name: a door opens/closes/shuts
examples: We were still waiting for the train doors to open.

children.name: a door slams/bangs
children.definition: shut
examples: (= shuts loudly )I heard the front door slam.

children.name: a door flies/bursts open
children.definition: opens very suddenly and quickly
examples: Then the door burst open and two men with guns came in.

children.name: a door swings open/shut
children.definition: moves forward to open or backwards to shut
examples: The door swung shut behind me.

children.name: a door slides open/shut
children.definition: moves smoothly to the side or back again
examples: The lift doors slid open and we got in.

children.name: lock/unlock the door
examples: I locked the door and turned out the lights.

children.name: bolt the door
children.definition: slide a metal bar across to fasten it
examples: Once inside, he bolted the door.

children.name: knock on/at the door
children.definition: hit it with your hand to make someone open it
examples: Who's that knocking at the door?

children.name: bang/hammer on the door
children.definition: hit it very loudly and urgently
examples: A policeman was banging on the door across the road.

children.name: tap on/at the door
children.definition: hit it very gently
examples: I tapped on the door and opened it.

children.name: answer the door
children.definition: open it for sb who has knocked or pressed the bell
examples: Lucy ran downstairs to answer the door.

children.name: get the door
children.definition: open or close it for sb
examples: Could you get the door for me?

children.name: the front/back/side door
children.definition: of a house
examples: I heard someone knocking at the front door.|Use the back door if your boots are muddy.

children.name: the main door
children.definition: the door into a building that most people use
examples: The main door to the hotel is on Queen Street.

children.name: the kitchen/bedroom/bathroom etc door
examples: The kitchen door opened and Jake walked in.

children.name: the cupboard door
examples: British English,the closet doorAmE: Both the cupboard doors were locked.

children.name: the fridge/oven door
examples: Steam came out as I opened the oven door.

children.name: a car door
examples: She heard a car door slamming.

children.name: the passenger door
children.definition: for the person in a car who sits beside the driver
examples: The taxi driver was holding open the passenger door.

children.name: a rear door
children.definition: a door at the back of a vehicle
examples: The kids opened the rear doors and climbed in.

children.name: a door handle
children.definition: that you move up or down to open a door
examples: Ella reached for the door handle.

children.name: a door knob
children.definition: that you turn to open a door
examples: I turned the door knob and went into the room.

children.name: a door knocker
children.definition: a metal object on a door that you use to knock with
examples: There was a brass door knocker in the shape of a lion's head.

children.name: a door bell
children.definition: that you press to make it ring
examples: Adam walked up the path and rang the door bell.

children.name: a door key
examples: She was looking in her bag for her door key.

children.name: exit
children.definition: a door or space through which you can leave a public room, building etc :
examples: We made for the nearest exit.
Two men were blocking her exit.

children.name: a fire/emergency exit
children.definition: a special door, used if there is an emergency or a fire
examples: Fire crews discovered that the club’s fire exit door had been locked.

children.name: the front/rear/side exit
examples: When the lights dimmed, she slipped out by the rear exit.

children.name: the nearest exit
examples: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion, using the nearest exit.

children.name: head for/make for the exit
children.definition: go to the exit
examples: Disappointed fans began heading for the exits.

children.name: use an exit
examples: In the event of a fire, please use the emergency exit nearest to you.

children.name: an exit door
examples: Exit doors shouldn’t be blocked at any time.

children.name: an exit route
children.definition: a way out of a building, plane etc, used in an emergency or a fire
examples: Staff must become familiar with the building’s exit routes.

children.name: an exit sign
children.definition: one showing where an exit is
examples: There was a red glowing exit sign over the door.

children.name: entrance
children.definition: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a placeOPP exit
examples: entrance to/of
themain entranceto the school

children.name: the main entrance
examples: She found a parking space close to the hospital's main entrance.

children.name: the front/back/rear/side entrance
examples: There is a long drive with steps leading to the front entrance.

children.name: a narrow entrance
examples: I could see part of the yard through the narrow entrance.

children.name: a wide entrance
examples: There was a wide entrance at the front of the building.

children.name: the hotel/hospital/museum etc entrance
examples: Our taxi pulled up outside the hotel entrance.

children.name: the harbour entrance
examples: British English,the harbor entranceAmerican English We watched as the ferry approached the harbour entrance.

children.name: the tunnel entrance
examples: At high tide, the tunnel entrance is totally submerged.

children.name: come/go/pass etc through an entrance
examples: People passed in single file through the narrow entrance.

children.name: use an entrance
examples: It's quicker to use the side entrance.

children.name: block an entrance
examples: A large stone blocked the entrance to the tomb.

children.name: an entrance hall
children.definition: a room at the entrance to a building
examples: He walked through the front door into the entrance hall.

children.name: an entrance lobby/foyer
children.definition: an area at the entrance to a large building
examples: There was no sign of her in the entrance foyer.

children.name: an entrance gate/door
examples: Soldiers were guarding the entrance gate.

children.name: door
children.definition: the space made by an open door

children.name: a door leads somewhere
children.definition: used to say what place is on the other side of a door
examples: This door leads into the garden.

children.name: in/out (of)/through the door
examples: Rick turned and ran out of the door.
I glanced through the open door.

children.name: doorway
children.definition: the space where a door opens into a room or building : cửa ra vào

children.name: in the doorway
examples: There was Paolo,standing in the doorway.
She stood in the doorway for a moment before going in.

children.name: homeless people sleeping in shop doorways
